organic.title: Quilt Pattern names - Antique Quilt History
organic.snippet: The first known quilt pattern published in an American periodical was the honeycomb or hexagon pattern published by the Godey's Lady's Book in 1835.

organic.title: Quilts 101: Identifying Vintage and Antique Quilts -
organic.snippet: Quilts from the 1920s or earlier are antique and vintage quilts were made between 1930 and 1965. Up until the mid-20 century, most quilts were made by hand.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there an app to identify quilt patterns?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Quiltography is a unique, time and money saving mobile digital quilt design tool for the modern quilter. Reduce the need to buy expensive patterns, limit fabric wastage and make it quick and easy to search and audition fabrics to help design your next quilt.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Quiltography

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you tell how old your quilt is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The piecing, by hand or machine, quilt pattern, weave and color of the fabric as well as the batting are taken into consideration when identifying the age of a quilt. Quilts made from the 1920's-1950 are considered "vintage" quilts.
